title: Math for Economists
description: Topics include matrix algebra, limits and open sets, implicit functions and their derivatives, quadratic forms and definite matrices, unconstrained and constrained static optimization, dynamic optimization and economic applications.
restrictions: __HEADER_0__Cannot be enrolled in one of the following Levels:
__HEADER_1__Must be enrolled in one of the following Campuses:
prerequisites: MATH 2401 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D and MATH 1522 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or (MATH 1551 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D and MATH 1553 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D and MATH 2551 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D)
